about me

Well, my name is Diego Dorta and I am a full-time Systems and Applications Engineer at NXP Semiconductors in Campinas - SP. I was born in Itapira - SP, my parents still live there, and it is not far from me so I can see them anytime to complaim about life.

I got a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, my grandma was born in Italy so it runs pasta in my blood, riddles, kitchen, astronomy and spotify are part of me.

This blog has my personal notes which are broadly intended to provide knowledge about things that I considered cool. You might learn very useful things here, however takes as a disclaimer that most of these notes are adapted and sometimes directly copied from elsewhere.

I’m not politician, I am lazy enough for not including references. So, for my owns and for those which are not mine I take no credit at all. I just do not mind :)

Further informations about i.MX you can get into our i.MX Dev Blog. I’m also creating a high-level abstraction called PyIMX for boards manipulation.

Trust my references:

  • Advanced Programming in the Unix Environment.
  • Unix Network Programming.
  • Linux in a Nutshell.
